title: Regarding the issue of emails being sent to destinations other than their intended recipients when sending emails consecutively
content:
I followed the steps below on a Windows 11 device, Thunderbird 115.18.0esr, and the issue occurred as shown in the results. Is this an existing or new bug?

Also, are there any countermeasures?

<Procedure> ‚ë† Prepare a 6MB file ‚ë° Prepare 50 recipient addresses ‚ë¢ Prepare 5 CC addresses ‚ë£ Create 50 emails for each recipient (file: '‚ë†', CC: '‚ë¢') and save as drafts. ‚ë§ Copy the email created in '‚ë£' to Explorer. ‚ë• Select all '‚ë£' and press Enter to open 50 windows. ‚ë¶ Press the Mail button repeatedly from the top window to the top left. ‚ëß Drag and drop the email file from '‚ë§' into the draft and perform '‚ë•' and '‚ë¶'. ‚ë® Repeat '‚ëß'.

<Results> After approximately 70 attempts, we encountered issues where the sending process would not complete and the window would not close, and the email in that window would be sent to an address other than the one specified. The email was not sent to the correct address, so pressing Cancel and sending again worked correctly (sent to the correct recipient).
creator: thunders

title: Download issue
content: I had to rebuild my Thunderbird profile and all seemed ok. However, I now have a possible download issue. As you can see from the attachment, the blue download indicator is stuck as shown. On the attachment I have also shown the activity indicator screenshots from over an hour and which shows almost no movement. What's interesting comparing my Thunderbird United Inbox with the actual Google inbox, I seem to have all my emails in Thunderbird. Any advice?

title: Thunderbird eats all memory
content:
Since i updated to 144 Thunderbird works well once started for a few minutes and then starts eating memory and in a few minutes it uses all system memory (64GB) and when virtual memory is exhausted it crashes

Now using 145 beta with same problem.

Using google calendar and only one plugin (Clippings for Thunderbird), tried to disable plugins, calendar, hardware acceleration, tried to compact folders, clear cache, clear msf with no success

title: Thunderbird 140.4.0esr (64-bit) - LINUX - no numbers shown when typing on new email...
content:
Hello This is rather weird... to me at least!

I recently noticed while I was replying an email, that when I type numbers they are not visible.

If I send email - sent it to myself, I can see numbers are there!

Only happens on new emails!

I already tried downgrading up to the point I could not downgrade more as - it obviously and annoyingly cannot load emails on a not very old version.

Never mind that - I much preferred version 1115-125 really.

Can anyone help.

I am going insane.

On any other computer with various version all works.

Thank you M
